inputs_required_from_company.nutFactorK_validation: You must supply K values backed by manufacturer/test data for each lubricant you allow (this is where wet-vs-dry torque differences come from).
inputs_required_from_company.allowable_stress_at_temperature: If you want at-temperature bolt strength, source it from your licensed ASME Section II Part D allowables (temperature-dependent). Use placeholders below.

fasteners.threadSeriesDefaultRule: IF D_in>=1.0 THEN default='8UN' ELSE default='UNC' (user can override)

stud_vs_bolt.note: Same torque math; just store length, stickout, and nut engagement checks.

torque_calculation.target_torque_used_rule: if specifiedTargetTorqueFtLb not null -> use it else use calculatedTargetTorqueFtLb

nut_factor_method.note: This is the common industry nut-factor relationship used in PCC-1-style practice; accuracy depends heavily on K validation.

boltNumbering.rule: Bolt #1 at ~12 o'clock; number clockwise 1..N for display and check-pass order.

sequenceLookup.note: Clockwise numbering; sequence array provides tightening order.

flange_face_damage_dropdown.label: Flange face free of scratches/nicks/gouges/burrs - especially radial damage
options: Anything other than Yes: Remediate the Problem and then Continue

flange_parallel_dropdown.label: Flange faces are parallel and centered
options: Anything other than Yes: Remediate the Problem and then Continue
